articles.headline: Maker of Generic Lipitor Halts Production
articles.snippet: Ranbaxy Pharmaceuticals, the largest producer of the generic version of Lipitor, has halted production of the drug until it can figure out how some pills were contaminated with glass particles.
articles.abstract: Ranbaxy Pharmaceuticals, the largest producer of the generic version of Lipitor, has halted production of the drug until it can figure out how some pills were contaminated with glass particles.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ranbaxy Pharmaceuticals, the largest producer of the generic version of Lipitor, has halted production of the drug until it can figure out why glass particles may have ended up in pills that were distributed to the public, the Food and Drug Administration announced Thursday.

articles.headline: A Clash of Auditors in H.P. Deal
articles.snippet: Each of the Big Four accounting firms has some involvement in the controversy over Hewlett-Packard’s acquisition of the software company Autonomy.
articles.abstract: Each of the Big Four accounting firms has some involvement in the controversy over Hewlett-Packard’s acquisition of the software company Autonomy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The battle over Hewlett-Packard’s claim that it was bamboozled when it bought Autonomy, a British software company, has been long on angry rhetoric and short on details about the accounting that was supposedly wrong and led to an $8.8 billion write-down.

articles.headline: Chamber Competes to Be Heard in the Fiscal Debate
articles.snippet: For the Chamber of Commerce, long the leading business voice in Washington, negotiations over the nation’s debt will be a test of whether it can retain its influence.
articles.abstract: For the Chamber of Commerce, long the leading business voice in Washington, negotiations over the nation’s debt will be a test of whether it can retain its influence.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After months of sparring with President Obama in the heat of the campaign season, Chamber of Commerce executives came to the White House this week with a far more conciliatory tone, offering up suggestions to avert large budget cuts without having to raise taxes.

articles.headline: Despite Setbacks, Investor Is Bullish on Clean Technology
articles.snippet: After taking a hit on investments in biofuel companies, Vinod Khosla seems unwavering in his commitment to the clean energy industry, pouring more money into start-ups.
articles.abstract: After taking a hit on investments in biofuel companies, Vinod Khosla seems unwavering in his commitment to the clean energy industry, pouring more money into start-ups.
articles.lead_paragraph: Vinod Khosla crowed about the clean energy industry last year. Three of the biofuel start-ups in his venture capital portfolio had just gone public, and the stocks had risen considerably after their debuts. “I challenge anybody to claim that clean tech done right is a disaster,” Mr. Khosla said at a conference, rebuffing recent criticism. “We’ve generated more profits there than anybody has.”

articles.headline: Experts Fear Life Insurers Are Courting Reserve Risk
articles.snippet: The study found a surge of obscure financial deals in the life insurance industry, but disagreed over what to do about it.
articles.abstract: The study found a surge of obscure financial deals in the life insurance industry, but disagreed over what to do about it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After more than a year studying a surge of intricate financial deals in the life insurance industry, regulators said Thursday that they had found transactions that could “give the industry a black eye,” but could not agree on what to do about them.

articles.headline: Under One Roof, Building for Extended Families
articles.snippet: Multigenerational living, a throwback to the past, is a growing trend in the struggling economy, and major homebuilders are designing flexible layouts.
articles.abstract: Multigenerational living, a throwback to the past, is a growing trend in the struggling economy, and major homebuilders are designing flexible layouts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tom and Kristin Moser’s new house — nearly 3,000 square feet in a development outside Tucson — has all the modern amenities, including solar panels and an open kitchen. But their house also has a feature that the builders are betting will be a hit, like the dog showers and craft rooms that beckoned during the boom. Tucked inside is a one-bedroom apartment with its own garage and a discrete entrance around the side.

articles.headline: Ethnic Hatred Tears Apart a Region of Myanmar
articles.snippet: In western Myanmar, clashes have left at least 167 people dead and 100,000 people homeless, most of them Muslims.
articles.abstract: In western Myanmar, clashes have left at least 167 people dead and 100,000 people homeless, most of them Muslims.
articles.lead_paragraph: SITTWE, Myanmar — The Buddhist monastery on the edge of this seaside town is a picture of tranquillity, with novice monks in saffron robes finding shade under a towering tree and their teacher, U Nyarna, greeting a visitor in a sunlit prayer room.

articles.headline: Tax Burden for Most Americans Is Lower Than in the 1980s
articles.snippet: Despite their complaints, most Americans in 2010 paid far less in total taxes — federal, state and local — than they would have paid 30 years ago, according to an analysis by The Times.
articles.abstract: Despite their complaints, most Americans in 2010 paid far less in total taxes — federal, state and local — than they would have paid 30 years ago, according to an analysis by The Times.
articles.lead_paragraph: BELLEVILLE, Ill. — Alan Hicks divides long days between the insurance business he started in the late 1970s and the barbecue restaurant he opened with his sons three years ago. He earned more than $250,000 last year and said taxes took more than 40 percent. What’s worse, in his view, is that others — the wealthy, hiding in loopholes; the poor, living on government benefits — are not paying their fair share.
articles.byline: By Binyamin Appelbaum and Robert Gebeloff
